abstract: Pres Obama suggests to African officials during four-day trip that America is better economic partner than China; president wants to reverse trade decline between United States and Africa, down from $142 billion in 2008 to $73 billion in 2014; decrease is attributed to Africans favoring trade with Chinese, who offer enticements such as low interest loans to credit-risky nations in exchange for natural resource rights.
lead_paragraph: Without quite saying so explicitly, the president made the argument that, when it comes to trade, Washington offers a more empowering vision for the future.

headline.main: Obama, on China’s Turf, Presents U.S. as a Better Partner for Africa
headline.print_headline: A Barely Veiled Pitch on China’s Turf

snippet: Without quite saying so explicitly, the president made the argument that, when it comes to trade, Washington offers a more empowering vision for the future.
